CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the city of GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant 's claim against the ORG - owned enterprise “ GPE Zavod ” ( the “ GPE ) , and ordered the latter to pay the applicant LAW in salary arrears . On DATE ORG ( the “ Bailiffs ” ) instituted enforcement proceedings .

CARDINAL . By decisions of DATE , DATE and DATE , ORG allowed the applicant 's claims and ordered the ORG to pay the applicant a total of UAH CARDINAL . The Bailiffs instituted enforcement proceedings on DATE , DATE and CARDINAL DATE respectively .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG instituted bankruptcy proceedings against the debtor and , consequently , all enforcement proceedings were suspended . On DATE the bankruptcy case was terminated and the enforcement proceedings were resumed .

CARDINAL . In DATE a substantial part of the debtor 's assets was attached by the Bailiffs ; however its sale was barred by the PERSON on the Introduction of a Moratorium on the Forced Sale of Property , which banned the forced sale of assets belonging to undertakings in which the ORG held PERCENT of the share capital .

CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE the Bailiffs informed the applicant that the decisions in his favour had not been executed due to the substantial number of enforcement proceedings against the debtor and the debtor 's lack of funds .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was paid the amounts due to him in full .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgment of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE and DATE , DATE ) .
